units.title: Paneth cell differentiation protocol
units.text: Paneth cells. CHIR (4 μM), DAPT (10 μM), pVc (100 μg/mL) and IL-22 (2 ng/mL). Culture for 3 days.
units.rationale: This is a clear, actionable protocol step specifying reagents and duration for Paneth cell differentiation.

units.title: Goblet cell differentiation protocol
units.text: Goblet cells. SJ000291942 (10 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM) and DAPT (10 μM) for 2 days and then replace CHIR with IWR-1 (2 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: This step details a two-phase differentiation protocol with specific reagents and timing for Goblet cell induction.

units.title: Enteroendocrine cell differentiation protocol
units.text: Enteroendocrine cells. DMH1 (2 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), DAPT (10 μM), CP673451 (0.5 μM) and Geﬁtinib (5 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: This provides a complete, timed protocol with specific small molecules for enteroendocrine cell differentiation.

units.title: Enterocyte differentiation protocol
units.text: Enterocytes. EGF (50 ng/mL), IGF-I (100 ng/mL), FGF-2 (50 ng/mL), SJ000291942 (10 μM), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), IWR-1 (2 μM) and VPA (0.75 mM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: This is a detailed, timed protocol specifying growth factors and inhibitors for enterocyte differentiation.

units.title: M cell differentiation protocol
units.text:
M cells. TNF-α (50 ng/mL) treated for the ﬁrst 4 hours and RANKL (100 ng/mL) for total 3 days.
Tissues were washed with DPBS to remove debris. The tissues were treated with 2.5 mM EDTA at 4 °C for 40 minutes to release crypts. The supernatant containing crypts was collected and embedded in Cultrex RGF BME (R&D Systems) droplets in 48-well plates (~50 crypts/well). After solidiﬁcation, droplets were overlaid with culture medium containing 10 μM Y-27632 (TargetMol).
units.rationale: This specifies a time-dependent treatment protocol with two distinct phases for M cell induction.

units.title: Organoid dissociation and re-embedding
units.text: Established organoids were dissociated into single cells with TrypLE (Gibco) and re-embedded in fresh BME at a density of approximately 8000 cells per well, in a total volume of 20 μL, within a 48-well plate.
units.rationale: This describes a standardized method for passaging organoids, including enzyme use and cell density.

units.title: EdU cell proliferation assay
units.text: Organoid culture medium was supplemented with 10 µM EdU (5 ethynyl-2’-deoxyuridine, Beyotime) and incubated for 1 hour. Organoids were then collected, ﬁxed, pe
units.rationale: This is a direct protocol step for labeling proliferating cells with EdU, despite partial text, it's actionable as written.

units.title: Flow cytometry sample preparation
units.text: Organoids were randomly taken from whole wells without being segmented and dissociated from the BME with TrypLE and dissociated into single cells. Cells were washed with ice-cold DPBS and ﬁltered into ﬂuorescence-activated cell sorting (FACS) tubes through a 40 μm cell strainer (Falcon).
units.rationale: This outlines a reproducible procedure for preparing organoid-derived single-cell suspensions for FACS.

units.title: Immunostaining sample preparation
units.text: taset and visualized using UMAP. Unsupervised graph-based clustering failed to separate Paneth cells, goblet cells, tuft cells, and secretory precursor cells, which were manually assigned based on their expression
units.rationale: This fragment is incomplete and lacks actionable protocol steps; excluded as it does not meet criteria for a procedural unit.
